ngiemboon: Meshǔ Jÿɔ̂b pa métá la te gíŋ ńne ńtsɔ́ʼɔ nò gie Jÿɔ̂b la ne ńgɔɔn wɔ́, ńtí nue Jÿɔ̂b la ne ńkwaŋa ngie aa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò Ssé.
en: So these three men quit answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gÿo púʼu, Elihu gẅie aa míŋ Mbalakɛɛ, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Mbúuzè, ńkẅɛɛ na tsìŋendá Lam. Á gyáŋa lóŋ na Jÿɔ̂b ńtí páʼ à la ne ńkwaŋa ngie aa ngàŋa nò nénʉ́ ńcʉa Ssé.
en: Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite   from the family of Ram became angry. He was angry at Job because he had justified  # 32:2 Jb 33:32; Jr 3:11; Ezk 16:51–52 himself rather than God.

ngiemboon: À la gíŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ tɛʼ ńtí meshǔ Jÿɔ̂b pie é laa métá la, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la te zsé lépÿɛɛ nò né Jÿɔ̂b wɔ́, ḿbiŋe ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńdaʼa yé laʼ.
en: He was also angry at Job’s three friends because they had failed to refute him and yet had condemned him.

ngiemboon: Elihu la júʼu nò gie pɔ́ la gɔɔn, ńzẅíʼte tá ḿbÿɛ, ńtí nue pɔ́ laa melÿò ńcʉa yé.
en: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because they were all older than he.

ngiemboon: Elihu la gwɔ́ tà ńgyá ngie yɔɔn mbàŋa yétá zagá pÿɛ, ńgyáŋa lóŋ.
en: But when he saw that the three men could not answer Job, he became angry.

ngiemboon: Elihu gẅie aa míŋ Mbalakɛɛ, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Mbúuzè, tsɔ́ʼ ngie:
en: So Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite replied:

ngiemboon: N da kwaŋa na yɔ́ɔn twó ngie: «Epʉ̀a pie nzẅìŋ ngùʼ wɔ́b gʉa mvfò zɔ̌ gẅiin légɔɔn nò,
en: I thought that age should speak

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ nénʉ́, ammó gie á gÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅiin legye,
en: But it is the spirit in a person—

ngiemboon: Nzẅìŋ ngùʼ légyɔ́ɔn té légẅiin zsénò wɔ́,
en: It is not only the old who are wise

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo n gɔɔn né pi ngie pi zẅíʼte nò gie n gɔɔn:
en: Therefore I say, “Listen to me.

ngiemboon: N ka júʼ meshwóŋè mí,
en: Look, I waited for your conclusions;

ngiemboon: N ka cwoŋo ńzẅíʼte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ka gɔɔn,
en: I paid close attention to you.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gɔɔn ngie: «Peg gyǎ zsénò;
en: So do not claim, “We have found wisdom;

ngiemboon: Menò mie Jÿɔ̂b ka gɔɔn, à kɔ̌ɔn těen ńgɔɔn né mèŋ wɔ́.
en: But Job has not directed his argument to me,

ngiemboon: Pi ka cÿɔʼ tà pi te gíŋe ńjúʼu légɔɔn nò wɔ́;
en: Job’s friends are dismayed and can no longer answer;

ngiemboon: N ka zẅíʼte, tà ńgɔɔn ngie: páʼ pɔ́ tsẅé jʉʼ légɔɔn nò la,
en: Should I continue to wait now that they are silent,

ngiemboon: n ge gɔɔn yɔ́ɔn nò fʉ̀ʼɔɔn,
en: I too will answer;

ngiemboon: Anò áa ncwò mèŋ tà ńdúe,
en: For I am full of words,

ngiemboon: Anò ŋwɛ́ áa lepfòm mèŋ fuʼu páʼ melùʼ mie é ne faʼa jʉʼ gie é ge fó wó kẅɛ.
en: My heart   is like unvented wine;

ngiemboon: Pi nyé wɔ́ɔn n gɔɔn nò ńdɔg ńtsɔ́ʼɔ zẅìge yɔ́ɔn.
en: I must speak so that I can find relief;

ngiemboon: N te gɔɔn nò lɔg kwoŋo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́,
en: I will be partial to no one,

ngiemboon: Á nue n zɔɔn te zsé lélʉte wɔ́:
en: For I do not know how to give such titles;
